ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I developed my ability to manage a big project and to manage several moving pieces on a research project. I learned how to refine my research and writing abilities.

This course was helpful in checking in with each other regarding the thesis writing process, demystifying the process, and it was really useful as a checkpoint to see where you were in the process as well.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
Strengths: I think the deadline and class meetings kept me on track to finishing making consistent progress. 

Weaknesses: I think it would have been helpful to have 1 or 2 opportunities from intensive feedback from either the professor or TA rather than just receiving general feedback.

Strengths: It was very chill, and not stress-inducing. Professor Wyrtzen and the TA Hannah definitely wanted us to succeed, and that was palpable. 
Weaknesses: I don't think anything about the class rubbed me the wrong way.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Succeeded: Flexible scheduling, we didn't take up more time than we needed to.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I would to any Socy senior. Writing a two-semester thesis is uniquely challenging and can be (for extended periods) very stressful and draining. It's a lot of work on top of other classes. Nonetheless, it is also a satisfying and rewarding experience if you pick a topic you are truly passionate about!
If you want to do research and have a supportive environment to do so, this is a great place to do that!

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
